Get artifacts managed by the workflow
Get a user task by id
Get all user tasks that involve the current user
Runtime Definitions
resources.description:
A runtime definition specifies information about a runtime image.

Default runtime definitions are immutable.

To use a custom image, you can create a custom runtime definition with this image and
then create a custom environment with the runtime definition.

resources.name: Package Extensions
resources.description:
A package extension describes a customization of a given software
specification by extending that software specification in any of two ways:

1. customization by conda yml file: a user-provided conda environment yml
file that specifies the additional dependencies. This package extension is
of type 'conda_yml'.

2. customization by custom library: an arbitrary user-provided library, for
example a python library, or a JAR file. This package extension is of type
'pip_zip'.

Package extensions are always scoped to a project or space. Only derived software specifications can hold
package extensions.

resources.name: Remove a package extension from a software specification.
Software Specifications
resources.description:
A software specification contains the metadata of a particular software description,
e.g. a description of a platform, installed libraries, etc.

Software specifications can be one of two types: `base` or `derived`.

Base software specifications are available in every project or space.

Derived software specifications are scoped to a project or space.
They point to a base software specification and may further be customized with package extensions
(see '/v2/package_extensions').
When a (derived) software specification has more than one package extension,
the order of the package extensions signifies the order in which they should
be applied on top of the base software specification.

There is a fixed set of base software specifications that are built-in in CPD. They are immutable.

Custom base software specification can be created with the credentials of the `wdp-service-id`.
Derived software specifications can be created with user credentials from the specific project or space.

resources.name: Add a package extension to a software specification.
Hardware Specifications
resources.description:
A hardware specification contains the metadata of a particular hardware description, 
e.g. number of CPU (cores), available memory, etc.

Hardware specifications either `global` or `scoped`.

Global hardware specifications are available in every project or space.

Scoped hardware specifications are available in a specific project or space.

There is a fixed set of global hardware specifications that are built-in in CPD. They are immutable.

Custom global hardware specifications can be created with the credentials of the `wdp-service-id`.
Scoped hardware specifications can be created with user credentials from the specific project or space.

resources.name: Environments
resources.description:
An environment collects all the information about a runtime environment, including but not limited to
software and hardware specifications.

Default environments are immutable. Custom environments are scoped to a project or space.
